ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: pre-treatment assessment or post-assessment

Screen Question 5: Are there any other things that have made you especially anxious or afraid, like flying, seeing blood, getting a shot, heights, closed places, or certain kinds of animals or insects?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes; -7 = N/A

ElementDescription: marked fear or anxiety about a specific object or situation
Notes: 1= absent or false; 2 = subthreshold; 3 = threshold or true; 4 = Severe;-7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported; -1 = Inadequate Information/Unknown

ElementDescription: phobic object or situation almost always provokes immediate fear or anxiety
Notes: 1= absent or false; 2 = subthreshold; 3 = threshold or true; 4 = Severe;-7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported; -1 = Inadequate Information/Unknown

ElementDescription: phobic situation(s) is actively avoided or endured with intese fear or anxiety
Notes: 1= absent or false; 2 = subthreshold; 3 = threshold or true; 4 = Severe;-7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported; -1 = Inadequate Information/Unknown

ElementDescription: fear or anxiety is out of proportion to the actual danger posed by the specific object or situation and to the sociocultural context
Notes: 1= absent or false; 2 = subthreshold; 3 = threshold or true; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported; -1 = Inadequate Information/Unknown

ElementDescription: the fear, anxiety, or avoidance is persistent, typically lasting for 6 months or more
Notes: 1= absent or false; 2 = subthreshold; 3 = threshold or true; 4 =  Severe; -7 = N/A; -9 = missing or not reported; -1 = Inadequate Information/Unknown

ElementDescription: the fear, anxiety, or avoidance causes clinically significant distress or impairment in occupational, or other important areas of functioning
Notes: 1= Absent or False; 2= Subthreshold; 3= Threshold or True; 4= Mild; 5=  Moderate; 6= Severe; -7= N/A; -9= Missing or Not Reported; -1= Inadequate Information/Unknown

ElementDescription: disturbance is not better explained by another mental disorder
Notes: 1= absent or false; 2= subthreshold; 3= threshold or true; -7= N/A; -9= missing or not reported; -1= Inadequate Information/Unknown

ElementDescription: Criteria A, B, C, D, E, F, & G coded 3
Notes: 1=False; 3=True

ElementDescription: during past 6 months marked fear or anxiety about one or more social situations

ElementDescription: during past 6 months phobic situation(s) is actively avoided or endured with intense fear or anxiety

ElementDescription: during the past 6 months fear, anxiety, or avoidance causes clinically significant distress or impairment in social, occupational, or other important areas of functioning
Notes: 1= Absent or False; 2= Subthreshold; 3= Threshold or True; 4= Mild; 5=  Moderate; 6= Severe; -7= N/A; -9= Missing or Not Reported; -1= Inadequate Information/Unknown

ElementDescription: criteria A, C, and F coded "3" for past 6 months
